lines.content: * The main entry point and orchestrator for the Barry chatbot application.

*

Barry coordinates interactions between the {@code Ui} (user I/O), {@code Parser} (command parsing),
* It runs the main input loop, executes user commands, and saves tasks whenever the list changes.
* Creates a new Barry chatbot instance.
* Initializes UI and storage components, then attempts to load
* saved tasks from the given file path.

* executes the corresponding operations on the task list,
* when the task list is modified.

* Represents exceptions specific to the Barry chatbot.
* Used to signal user input errors, corrupted data files,
* that should be reported to the user in a controlled way.
* Constructs a BarryException with the specified message.
* @param msg Error message describing the failure.
* Represents the supported user command types understood by the chatbot.
* Represents a parsed user command and its extracted arguments.

*

{@code ParsedInput} is produced by {@link barry.parser.Parser} and consumed by the main application
* to execute the intended action. Depending on the command type, it may store a task description,
* date/time values, and/or one or more task numbers.
* Creates a parsed representation for commands that have no arguments (e.g., LIST, BYE).
return new ParsedInput(type, null, null, null, null, null);

* Creates a parsed representation of an EVENT command.

* Creates a parsed representation of commands that operate on one or more task numbers

* Creates a parsed representation of a FIND command.

return new ParsedInput(Command.FIND, keyword, null, null, null, null);

* Represents a generic task with a description and completion status.

*

{@code Task} is the abstract concept underlying all task types in the application.
* Subclasses such as {@code ToDo}, {@code Deadline}, and {@code Event} extend this class
* to include task-type-specific data while reusing the common done/undone behavior.
* Constructs a task with the given description.
* Represents the in-memory list of tasks managed by the Barry chatbot.

*

This class encapsulates the internal task collection and provides operations to add, remove,
* retrieve, and validate access to tasks. It centralizes task-list-related logic such as index checking,
* reducing direct manipulation of the underlying list by other components.
* Constructs a task list initialized with the given tasks.
* @param tasks Initial tasks to store in the list.
* Adds a task to the list.
* Removes and returns the task at the specified 0-based index.
* @param index 0-based index of the task to remove.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If index is out of range.
* Returns the task at the specified 0-based index.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If index is out of range.
* Returns the number of tasks currently in the list.
* Validates that a 1-based task number refers to an existing task in this list.
* @param taskNum 1-based task number (e.g., 1 refers to the first task).
* @throws BarryException If the task number is out of range.
public void checkIndex1Based(int taskNum) throws BarryException {
throw new BarryException("Task number out of range.");

A {@code ToDo} has no associated date/time; it is simply an item the user intends to do.

*

This class is responsible for reading commands from standard input and displaying messages
* (e.g., welcome text, task lists, confirmations, and error messages) in a consistent format.

Hello! I'm Barry.
What can I do for you?

* Displays the farewell message when the user exits the program.

* Displays an error message to the user in a consistent UI format.
* @param msg The error message to display.

System.out.println("Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays a message indicating a task was deleted successfully.
